definition: to keep sb company for a chat/(esp.) to be a paid escort
to accompany/to keep sb company/to assist/old variant of 賠|赔[pei2]
to chat/to depend upon (literary)/temporarily/just/slightly

sentences.english: They only offer professional chatting service.
sentences.chinese: 他們只提供專業的陪聊服務。

sentences.english: And I don't think people can accept the service in the public toilet.
sentences.chinese: 我不認爲人們會接受在廁所陪聊這樣服務。

sentences.english: There is chatting service provided in the public toilet, is it ridiculous or the creative?
sentences.chinese: 公廁裏推出陪聊服務是創新還是雷人？

sentences.english: Come on! Chatting pals? Making money by talking? Do you really believe it?
sentences.chinese: 得了吧。陪聊夥伴？聊天賺錢？你真的相信嗎？

definition: to trade sex for favorable treatment (career advancement, higher grades, rent-free accommodation etc)/to sleep in the same bed as one's child
(dialect) to talk nonsense/to chat idly
(dialect) to chat/to gossip
(Internet slang) to post a photo of oneself online
erhua variant of 聊天[liao2 tian1]
to chatter
to gossip/to chat (dialect)
to buy an all-night package/(esp.) to book a prostitute for the night
endless night (idiom); fig. long suffering
drowsy/sleepy
(slang) friend with benefits/casual sex partner
the middle of the night
to look after a hospitalized loved one
to chatter idly/to gossip/to boast or brag
to cry out in ecstasy (during lovemaking)
phonetic a, similar to 呵/-azine, see 吖嗪[a1 qin2]
euphemistic equivalent of 他媽的|他妈的[ta1 ma1 de5]
